ğŸ“¢ The results of the nominations are announced by the Presiding Officer to the Senedd. 

ğŸ‘‘ They recommend to the Queen that the Member nominated be appointed as First Minister.

âŒ If they donâ€™t, the process continues, with the candidate with the lowest number of votes being eliminated each time. 

ğŸ—³ï¸ Further votes by roll call will take place until one candidate has received more than half of the votes cast.

â• If more than two Members are nominated, the Presiding Officer will ask Members to vote for their preferred candidate.

ğŸ—³ï¸ This time a Member needs to receive more votes than all other candidates combined to be declared the nominee.

2âƒ£ If two Members are nominated, then MSs will vote to choose who they want to become the First Minister. 

ğŸ—³ï¸ The candidate who gets the greatest number of votes cast will be declared the nominee for the First Minister of Wales.

ğŸ™‹â€â™€ï¸ğŸ™‹â€â™‚ï¸ If more than one Member is nominated to be First Minister, this is where it gets interesting. 

ğŸ’¬ The Llywydd will begin a roll call, and Members will be asked who theyâ€™d want to be the First Minister.

1âƒ£ If only one Member is nominated, the Llywydd will declare that member to be the nominee.

For the first time in the Senedd's history, Members have been able to take their oaths via video, with our Chief Executive present in the Siambr. @JackSargeantAM took his oath from his home yesterday. https://t.co/Ml3oBlKWd8
@hexter101 Footage and images have been made available for use by press, media and MS.

@hexter101 Thanks for your interest. We are not able to broadcast the oath-taking live due to the fact that they are not done continuously. Time needs to be allowed for virtual ceremonies and cleaning between ceremonies.
 
Some Members have also chosen to do their ceremonies in private.
@GwynforO @MarkDrakeford @ElinCeredigion Bore da Gwynfor. Members have been taking oaths online, in the Senedd and in our offices in Colwyn Bae.

The results are coming in and over the weekend the newly elected Members will be taking their oaths. Oath-taking will take place in the Senedd, online via video and in our Colwyn Bay office.
